Wandering is a Major Concern for Parents of Children with Autism

A recently published study by Journal Pediatrics found that 49% of children with autism were prone to wander or bolt from safe environments. We have heard many stories about children with autism innocently wandering from their homes. Sadly, most of these stories have had tragic endings; more than one third of children with autism who wander are never or rarely able to communicate their name, address, or phone number. Through the monitoring of a child's routes and locations, those that tend to wander can be kept safe and secure.

  • 49%
    Wandering

Life Transition Often Creates Confusion and Distress

Transition from elementary and secondary school can be a difficult time for individuals with autism. At any age, getting out and facing social interactions can be difficult for those affected by autism. Day-to-day activities such as shopping or using public transportation can cause confusion and anxiety.
Parents can stay close and assist their young ASD children in these significant life transitions.

AngelSense Solution

A patent-pending GPS tracking device designed specifically for the autism community. It can be used at kindergarten, outdoors, in the community and at school, keeping our children safe and giving our families peace of mind.

Don't wait for a wake up call. Provide your loved ones the safety they deserve!

Diary Schedule

Smart Search

Non-Removable Wearables

GPS wearables that address sensory sensitivities of special children

Missing Child Alert

Powerful feature designed to get the help of others to find a missing child
